Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content:
What are the pro and cons, and differences in costs, when choosing this in the composer:
"Choose whether to make your chain part of an ordinary non-fungible interoperability cluster, or whether to make your chain part of a fungible cluster with another existing Smart Chain."

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@D2D privacyalternatives.com 
there should be no difference in costs for the moment

this option is about the future

non-fungible interoperability cluster - all the smartchains in the same cluster that are notarised can exchange data (tokens etc.,) among themselves

fungible cluster - all the chains essentially represent the same crypto. can have different antara modules enabled, and coins moved from one chain to another, this is the scalability solution

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content: Not an easy choice : )

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content: if the fungible cluster is more scalable sounds good though

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content:
I'm just testing it anyway, also to understand the costs
If I choose the non-fungible option, it says: "Choose the number of the cluster that you‚Äôd like to join. The number must be less than 100."

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content: How do you decide which number to put there

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
it is just arbitrary right now, you have to select a number no other dPoWed chain already has

until your chain gets dPoW activated, this option doesn't matter
some work needs to be dne to better explain this option

for now select any number
it will have antara modules enabled

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content: ok thanks

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content: it asks "Remember my Cluster", should I tick that box?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
as you wish
it will just auto fill the same number when you are creating another chain

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content: OK thanks

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content:
I also wanted to ask the following things:

1.  Does Komodo have (or will have soon) a wallet that interacts with the user through the browser (like Metamask)

2. Is there a guide somewhere to understand what needs to be done for regulations etc when launching a coin.
    For example if you create a blockchain and put the coins on AtomicDEX, Barterlly and other exchanges, what do you 
    need to do for compliance?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
```
Does Komodo have (or will have soon) a wallet that interacts with the user through the browser (like Metamask)
```
in the works. more secure than metamask #dev-nspv 

```
Is there a guide somewhere to understand what needs to be done for regulations etc when launching a coin.
    For example if you create a blockchain and put the coins on AtomicDEX, Barterlly and other exchanges, what do you 
    need to do for compliance?
```
this is practically impossible to provide as there are too many jurisdictions and contradicting laws based on locations of issuer and buyer

the only thing we can say is trade of crypto from user to user in a true DEX like atomicDEX is exempt from money transamitter lisense

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: @D2D privacyalternatives.com `https://docs.komodoplatform.com/nSPV/`

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content: OK thank you

Author: phm87#7395
Content: I installed a private gitlab on a server. Maybe we should backup everything from github to private repos. If github is closed or forbid crypto, we can keep history. I did it since 2 years because it happened that the github repo is deleted because of exit scam

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content:
There's a cool app (in beta) that I'm using that lets you mine from the mobile phone, you just have to tap on the mine button once a day. In a few months they've gained over 150k users/miners. If the Komodo ecosytem created something like this it could be great, even just for the exposure it can give to the ecosystem:
https://minepi.com/
